intro: Rutidea leucantha, commonly known as the white-flowered legume, is a species of flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy white or pale pink flowers. The plant typically grows in tropical and subtropical regions, often in humid environments such as forests or shrublands. Its root system forms symbiotic relationships with nitrogen-fixing bacteria, contributing to soil fertility. The plant's botanical features make it an important species in ecological studies and horticultural applications.
